line_1: These words, the last my dying lips recite,
line_2: THESE, the last lines my trembling hands can write,
Why, CLOE, there's a fond delight

line_1: Put stay, why shou'd I mournfully recite
When some dull Pedant wou'd her Wars recite,
line_2: I'm sick of Troy, and in as great a Fright,

line_1: When some dull Pedant wou'd her Wars recite,
line_2: As was soft Paris, when compell'd to Fight.

line_1: The Thoughts of Gods let Granville's Verse recite,
line_2: And bring the Scenes of opening Fate to Light.

line_1: My master's favours, endless to recite,
line_2: When I with such ingratitude requite;

line_1: The song it 'vails not to recite —
line_2: Those banks and streams appear'd more bright

line_1: Attend, and be yourself, while I recite
line_2: (Oh! that I only can of losses write!)

line_1: Let Us, beneath these spreading Trees, recite
line_2: What from our Hearts our Muses may indite.
"Oh dear! you must sleep here to-night,"

line_1: If the King smiles, whilst I my Woe recite;
line_2: If weeping I find Favour in His Sight;

line_1: If the King smiles, whilst I my Woe recite;
line_2: Flow fast my Tears, full rising his Delight.

line_1: What Numbers can thy lovely Charms recite!
line_2: O Solitude! the Sage's chief Delight!
